summary: The concept of "videotelephony," which is redirected to the preferred term "video conference," pertains to the transmission of visual and audio signals over telecommunications networks, enabling real-time communication. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, video conferencing is increasingly recognized for its role in facilitating remote participation in legislative processes, enhancing accessibility, and promoting efficient communication among stakeholders. The EU has established guidelines to ensure that video conference technologies comply with data protection regulations, ensuring secure and reliable exchanges. This concept underscores the importance of digital communication tools in modern governance and regulatory practices within the EU.
